paper_title.en: Agile and highly efficient wavelength conversion using highly nonlinear fiber for optical code-labeled packets

description.en:
Wavelength conversion enhances transparency, interoperability, and efficient wavelength resource utilization in wavelength-division-multiplexing networks. Several devices are used for wavelength conversion, such as the electroabsorption modulator, semiconductor optical amplifier, periodically poled lithium niobate modulator, and highly nonlinear fiber (HNLF). HNLF is promising because it offers high conversion efficiency and phase-preservation between the input and output signals; it also provides immunity from pattern effects. Furthermore, a combination of HNLF and a distributed-feedback laser diode (DFB-LD) array used as a pump light source enables agile wavelength conversion for photonic packet switch networks.
In this letter, we discuss our demonstration of agile and highly efficient wavelength conversion of optical code-labeled packets by using HNLF and an eight-DFB-LD array module. We obtained a switching time of less than 1 ns, and the wavelength stability of the LD pump was within 0.04 nm.

paper_title.en: Agile and highly efficient wavelength conversion using highly nonlinear fiber for optical code-labeled packets

description.en:
Wavelength conversion enhances transparency, interoperability, and efficient wavelength resource utilization in wavelength-division-multiplexing networks. Several devices are used for wavelength conversion, such as the electroabsorption modulator, semiconductor optical amplifier, periodically poled lithium niobate modulator, and highly nonlinear fiber (HNLF). HNLF is promising because it offers high conversion efficiency and phase-preservation between the input and output signals; it also provides immunity from pattern effects. Furthermore, a combination of HNLF and a distributed-feedback laser diode (DFB-LD) array used as a pump light source enables agile wavelength conversion for photonic packet switch networks.
In this letter, we discuss our demonstration of agile and highly efficient wavelength conversion of optical code-labeled packets by using HNLF and an eight-DFB-LD array module. We obtained a switching time of less than 1 ns, and the wavelength stability of the LD pump was within 0.04 nm.

paper_title.ja: Multi-Stage Fiber Delay Line Buffer in Photonic Packet Switch for Asynchronously Arriving Variable-Length Packets
High-performance optical code generation and recognition using 511-chip 640-Gchip/s phase-shifted superstructured FBG

paper_title.en: Multi-Stage Fiber Delay Line Buffer in Photonic Packet Switch for Asynchronously Arriving Variable-Length Packets
High-performance optical code generation and recognition using 511-chip 640-Gchip/s phase-shifted superstructured FBG
40-Gb/s packet-selective photonic Add/Drop multiplexer based on optical-code label header processing

description.en: A packet-by-packet-selective photonic add/drop multiplexer, of the finest data granularity, is experimentally demonstrated at 40 Gb/s. An optical-code label, attached to the packet, enables determination, in the optical domain, of whether to drop, cut through, or add packets.

paper_title.en: 40-Gb/s packet-selective photonic Add/Drop multiplexer based on optical-code label header processing

description.en: A packet-by-packet-selective photonic add/drop multiplexer, of the finest data granularity, is experimentally demonstrated at 40 Gb/s. An optical-code label, attached to the packet, enables determination, in the optical domain, of whether to drop, cut through, or add packets.

paper_title.en: Experimental demonstration of performance improvement of 127-chip SSFBG en/decoder using apodization technique

description.en: We present the experimental result of apodiz 127-chip 160-Gchip/s superstructured fiber Bragg grating (SSFBG) en/decoder with Gold code in bipolar phase-shift key coherent time-spreading optical code-division multiple-access system. Compared with uniform SSFBGs, the apodized SSFBG demonstrates the overall performance improvements, including a high reflectivity and a good peak-to-wing ratio of autocorrelation as well as a good bit-error-rate performance.

paper_title.en: Experimental demonstration of performance improvement of 127-chip SSFBG en/decoder using apodization technique

description.en: We present the experimental result of apodiz 127-chip 160-Gchip/s superstructured fiber Bragg grating (SSFBG) en/decoder with Gold code in bipolar phase-shift key coherent time-spreading optical code-division multiple-access system. Compared with uniform SSFBGs, the apodized SSFBG demonstrates the overall performance improvements, including a high reflectivity and a good peak-to-wing ratio of autocorrelation as well as a good bit-error-rate performance.
